body.p: The Board observed that the entity’s payment to the tax authority represents, in substance, a payment to the counterparty (ie the employee) for the services received from the counterparty, despite the fact that the entity transfers the cash to the tax authority. This is because:

li.p: when the entity pays the amount withheld to the tax authority on behalf of the employee, the entity is acting as an agent for the employee; however,

the entity is also acting as a principal because it is fulfilling its obligation to the employee (ie the counterparty in the share-based payment transaction) to transfer cash (or other assets) for the goods or services received.
